page.title: 19Ecology in March
page.content: { Twenty two years ago}some waste land in{Norwood Road,near the railway,}was bought by the{Cambridgeshire and Isle of{Ely Naturalists Trust.}This was for a{nature reserve, because there were so{few birds in March. The ground was cleared and{hawthorns were planted to encourage the birds. Other trees in the reserve are; {willows, one oak, ash, elder.}Last year{300 birds nests were recorded. { Over 100,000 winter starlings}came from Germany to nest there,but they had to be scared away because of their damage to the trees. Other birds visiting the reserve are {magpies,jay,swans,heron,woodpecker, {owls,longtailed tit and warblers. { A path}has been made through the middle{to let light in.}This has made space for{grasses and shrubs}for {butterflies. }Nicola Styles.
